de.fhluebeck.group3.util

Class StringUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fhluebeck.group3.util.StringUtil

  • public final class StringUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Functions to handle or operate strings, like textProcessingBeforeOutput. Judge whether a string contains only numbers or letters or special elements like "@"
    Author:
    Eason.Hua on 2018/06/02

    • Method Detail

      • textProcessingBeforeOutput

        public static java.lang.String textProcessingBeforeOutput(java.lang.String rawString,
                                                          int lineWidth,
                                                          int maxWidth)
        Handle the text before output. This function will make the text more beautiful and readable and set the text suitable for presentation.
        Parameters:
        rawString - the raw string to be operated.
        lineWidth - the line width of presentation string, system will add new line mark "-\n" at every end of line.
        maxWidth - the maximum width of presentation string, the excess part will be replaced by "..."
        Returns:
        formatted string.

      • isNumeric

        public static boolean isNumeric(java.lang.String str)
        Judge whether the input string is numeric(consists only in numbers 0-9).
        Parameters:
        str - the input string.
        Returns:
        whether the input String is numeric.

      • isLetterOrDigit

        public static boolean isLetterOrDigit(java.lang.String str)
        Judge whether the input string is letter or digit(consists only in numbers 0-9,a-z,A-Z).
        Parameters:
        str - the input string.
        Returns:
        whether the input String is letter or digit.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Unit test for StringUtil.
        Parameters:
        args: - string from console input.
